text: Pamona (also Poso or Bare’e) is an Austronesian language spoken in Central and South Sulawesi, Indonesia. It is part of the northern group of the Kaili–Pamona languages. ==Dialects== Ethnologue lists as dialects: Laiwonu (Iba), Pamona (Poso), Rapangkaka (Aria), Taa (Topotaa, Wana), Tobau (Bare’e, Tobalo, Tobao), Tokondindi, Tomoni, Topada. ==Phonology== Pamona has the following sound inventory: {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |+caption | Consonants |- ! colspan=2| ! Labial ! Alveolar ! Palatal ! Velar !
